250 000 persons, 46 000 of whom were children (73% participation). Children less than 
5 years of age and women were targeted, and selection was not based on socioeconomic 
status. Resource intensity of the JNSP ranged from US$ 8â€“US$ 17/child per year 
(US$ 30/child per year total cost, equivalent to US$ 6 million). Intensity as measured by 
personnel was 2 village health workers/village (1220 total) or 1:40 children. 
JNSP evaluation data demonstrated a decrease in underweight from 50% to 35%
